sentence.Network_en: Brian counted to twenty and lifted his binoculars. Elena did the same.
sentence.Network_cn: 布赖恩数到20，举起了双筒望远镜。埃琳娜也照着做了。

sentence.Network_en: He found the binoculars and focused them on the boat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他找到双筒望远镜，然后调焦对准那艘船看。

sentence.Network_en: He raised the binoculars to his eye again, scanning across the scene.
sentence.Network_cn: 他再一次把双筒望远镜举到眼前，仔细观察整个现场。

双眼竞争(Binocular rivalry)是指进入左眼和右眼中的图像在我们感觉中交替呈现的一种视觉现象。在同一时刻,给两只眼睛呈现差异很大的两幅图像,就会发现我们感觉到的.
...主要依赖于两眼提供的线索，叫双眼视差(binocular parallax)(人有两只眼睛，它们之间大约相隔65mm.

entry.def: Binoculars consist of two small telescopes joined together side by side, which you look through in order to look at things that are a long way away.

means.word_mean: 1. an optical instrument designed for simultaneous use by both eyes
